definition: soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
Rutherford (name)/Ernest Rutherford (1871-1937), early nuclear physicist from New Zealand
Boyle (name)/Robert Boyle (1627-91), British and Irish scientist and pioneer chemist
Ludwig Boltzmann (1844-1906), Austrian physicist and philosopher
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Maxwell (name)/James Clerk Maxwell (1831-1879), Scottish physicist and mathematician, the originator of Maxwell's laws of electromagnetism and electromagnetic waves
Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯
Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen (1845-1923), German mechanical engineer
Fermi (name)/Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist
Huygens (name)/Christiaan Huygens (1629-1695), Dutch mathematician and astronomer
